thread.title: Jayson Castro to miss Game 7 due to hamstring injury
thread.title_full: Jayson Castro to miss Game 7 due to hamstring injury

author: Rappler.com
title: Jayson Castro to miss Game 7 due to hamstring injury
text:
PBA Jayson Castro to miss Game 7 due to hamstring injury TNT KaTropa will be without the services of their star point guard for a must-win Game 7 against the San Miguel Beermen Published 7:01 PM, February 20, 2017 Updated 7:05 PM, February 20, 2017 DROPPED CALL. Jayson Castro will not be on the court to help TNT KaTropa in their do-or-die match against San Miguel Beer. Photo by Czeasar Dancel/Rappler 
MANILA, Philippines - TNT KaTropa will be without the services of star point guard Jayson Castro for their Game 7 showdown against the San Miguel Beermen in the PBA Philippine Cup semifinals tonight, Monday, February 20. 
Castro sustained a hamstring injury in Game 6, according to the PBA's official twitter account. TNT coach Nash Racela confirmed the news to Rappler, saying Castro willl need one week of rest to recover from the strain. No Jayson Castro for TNT in tonight's game 7 vs SMB after sustaining a hamstring injury in game 6. #WeArePBA pic.twitter.com/pL1mHNSvNx — PBA (@pbaconnect) February 20, 2017 
TNT is hoping to bounce back from a 16-point defeat to the Beermen in Game 6 on Saturday in which Castro scored 19 points and dished 5 assists but left the game with 7 minutes to play after sustaining the injury. 
The winner of tonight's game between San Miguel and TNT will face the winner of tomorrow's Game 7 between Barangay Ginebra and Star in the PBA Finals, which start Friday, February 24. – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
